001package com.randomnoun.common.jessop;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005
006/* (c) 2020 randomnoun. All Rights Reserved. This work is licensed under a

009
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Map;
012
013import javax.script.Bindings;
014import javax.script.ScriptContext;
015import javax.script.ScriptEngine;
016import javax.script.ScriptEngineFactory;
017import javax.script.ScriptEngineManager;
018import javax.script.ScriptException;
019
020import org.graalvm.polyglot.proxy.ProxyObject;
021
022import com.randomnoun.common.jessop.engine.graaljs.GraalJsBindingsConverter;
023
024import junit.framework.TestCase;
025
026/** Test that graalvm works
027 * 
028 * @author knoxg
029 */
030public class GraalvmTest extends TestCase {
031
032        public static void listEngines(){ // Note 1
033        ScriptEngineManager mgr = new ScriptEngineManager();
034        List<ScriptEngineFactory> factories = mgr.getEngineFactories();
035        for (ScriptEngineFactory factory: factories) {
036            System.out.println("ScriptEngineFactory Info");
037            String engName = factory.getEngineName();
038            String engVersion = factory.getEngineVersion();
039            String langName = factory.getLanguageName();
040            String langVersion = factory.getLanguageVersion();
041            System.out.println("\tScript Engine: " + engName + ":" + engVersion);
042            List<String> engNames = factory.getNames();
043            for(String name: engNames) {
044                System.out.println("\tEngine Alias: " + name);
045            }
046            System.out.println("\tLanguage: " + langName + ":" + langVersion);
047        }
048    }
049        public void testGraalvm() throws ScriptException {
050        
051                listEngines();
052                
053                // this is the same test code as on https://wiki.python.org/jython/LearningJython#using-script-engine-support
054                ScriptEngineManager mgr = new ScriptEngineManager();
055            ScriptEngine eng = mgr.getEngineByName("graal-js");
056            Bindings bindings = eng.getBindings(ScriptContext.ENGINE_SCOPE);
057            bindings.put("polyglot.js.allowAllAccess", true);
058            // bindings.put("engine.WarnInterpreterOnly", false);
059            
060                // ScriptEngine eng = mgr.getEngineByName("rhino");
061            
062            // this is GraalJSScriptEngine
063                // rhino is com.sun.script.javascript.RhinoScriptEngine
064            // graal is  com.oracle.truffle.js.scriptengine.GraalJSScriptEngine
065            System.out.println("eng is " + eng.getClass().getName());
066
067            // except that eng here is null.
068            System.out.println("eng: " + String.valueOf(eng));
069            eng.put("var1", Integer.valueOf(257));
070            Object result = eng.eval("var1");
071            System.out.println("result is " + result);
072            
073            Map<String, Object> v = new HashMap();
074            v.put("x", 1234);
075            
076            Map<String, Object> v2 = new HashMap();
077            v.put("y", v2);
078            v2.put("z", 1234);
079            
080            List<Object> list = new ArrayList();
081            list.add("abc");
082            Map<String, Object> v3 = new HashMap();
083            v3.put("the", "thing");
084            list.add(v3);
085            
086            v.put("list", list);
087            
088            result = eng.eval("var1.x");
089            System.out.println("var1.x is " + result);
090
091            result = eng.eval("var1.y");
092            System.out.println("var1.y is " + result);
093
094            // z is undefined
095            //result = eng.eval("var1.y.z");
096            //System.out.println("var1.y.z is " + result);
097
098            // list is not defined
099            //result = eng.eval("var1.list[0]");
100            //System.out.println("var1.list[0] is " + result);
101
102            
103            System.out.println("=== var2");
104            
105            eng.put("var2", v);
106            // var2.get('x') works
107            // var2['x'] is null
108            // var2.x is null
109            result = eng.eval("var2.x");
110            System.out.println("result is " + result);
111
112            System.out.println("=== var3");
113            
114            eng.put("var3", ProxyObject.fromMap(v));
115            // var2.get('x') works
116            // var2['x'] is null
117            // var2.x is null
118            result = eng.eval("var3.x");
119            System.out.println("var3.x is " + result);
120            result = eng.eval("var3.y");
121            System.out.println("var3.y is " + result);
122            result = eng.eval("var3.y.z");
123            System.out.println("var3.y.z is " + result);
124            result = eng.eval("var3.list");
125            System.out.println("var3.list is " + result);
126            result = eng.eval("var3.list[0]");
127            System.out.println("var3.list[0] is " + result);
128
129            System.out.println("=== var4");
130            
131            GraalJsBindingsConverter bc = new GraalJsBindingsConverter();
132            eng.put("var4", bc.toScriptObject(v));
133            eng.put("var4List", bc.toScriptObject(v.get("list")));
134            
135            // var2.get('x') works
136            // var2['x'] is null
137            // var2.x is null
138            
139            // lists in maps
140            
141            result = eng.eval("var4.x");
142            System.out.println("var4.x is " + result);
143            result = eng.eval("var4.y");
144            System.out.println("var4.y is " + result);
145            result = eng.eval("var4.y.z");
146            System.out.println("var4.y.z is " + result);
147            result = eng.eval("var4.list");
148            System.out.println("var4.list is " + result);
149            result = eng.eval("var4.list[0]");
150            System.out.println("var4.list[0] is " + result);
151            
152            // maps in lists
153            
154            result = eng.eval("var4List");
155            System.out.println("var4List is " + result);
156            result = eng.eval("var4List[0]");
157            System.out.println("var4List[0] is " + result);
158            result = eng.eval("var4List[1]");
159            System.out.println("var4List[1] is " + result);
160            result = eng.eval("var4List[1].the");
161            System.out.println("var4List[1].the is " + result);
162            
163            
164            /*
165                ScriptContext defaultContext = eng.getContext();
166                if (eng instanceof Compilable) {
167                        defaultContext.setAttribute(ScriptEngine.FILENAME, "THEFILENAME", ScriptContext.ENGINE_SCOPE);
168                }
169            result = eng.eval("fnarg");
170            */
171            
172        }
173    
174}
